title: The women fighting South Africa's 'infodemic'
description: South Africa has faced a wave of Covid misinformation, but volunteers are fighting back.

title: Week in pictures: 27 March - 2 April 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: How Instagram’s influencers changed the model industry
description: Models have increasingly been asked to shoot their own photographs during the pandemic.

title: Violence against women: Loss, death and grieving in public
description: A month since Sarah Everard disappeared, two women share what it's like to grieve in the public eye.

title: Ros Atkins On… Macron’s Covid-19 Crisis
description: Coronavirus has forced France into a third lockdown and raised questions about President Emmanuel Macron’s leadership.

title: Street racing: They're fast, Atlanta's furious
description: Screeching tyres disturb the peace in Atlanta, Georgia, as street racers claim the city's highways.

title: Abigail Thorn: 'I came out as trans and made headlines'
description: Abigail Thorn is behind the popular channel Philosophy Tube, which has over 900,000 subscribers.

title: Lockdown policing: Cracking down on the coronavirus rule breakers
description: The BBC joined Lancashire Police as they broke up gatherings breaching lockdown rules.

title: Belgian police 'are supposed to protect us'
description: Campaigners in Belgium call for urgent reform of the police after a series of high profile deaths in custody.

title: World’s largest ocean monitoring system BRUVS launched
description: Marine scientist Professor Jessica Meeuwig on her hopes for a new ocean monitoring system.

title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp shocked by Trent Alexander-Arnold England omission
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he could not understand the move to leave Trent Alexander-Arnold out of the England squad.

title: My Money: 'Lockdown has been a blessing in disguise'
description: Thanucha, a pharmacology student from Hertfordshire, talks us through her lockdown spending.

title: Easter Weekend: How to keep socially anxious seals safe
description: If you're visiting the coast this Easter Weekend, conservationists want you to keep your distance from seals.

title: Dinosaur-killing asteroid strike gave rise to Amazon rainforest
description: The asteroid that killed off the dinosaurs gave birth to tropical rainforests, a study suggests.

title: Video captures deer flying through a school bus windshield
description: A student was taking a morning nap when he was abruptly woken up by something unexpected.

title: Taiwan: Dozens killed as train crashes and derails in tunnel
description: At least 48 people are dead and scores more injured in the island's worst rail disaster in decades.

title: Coronavirus: Dozens of MPs criticise 'divisive' Covid passports
description: They say demanding proof of a jab or test would be "dangerous" amid reports that trials are planned.

title: Leinster v Toulon off due to Covid-19 case in French team's camp
description: Leinster's Heineken Champions Cup last-16 match against Toulon is called off after an unnamed member of the Toulon squad tests positive for Covid-19.

title: Loot boxes linked to problem gambling in new research
description: New research says there is a clear link between video game boxes and "problem gambling behaviours".

title: Scotland stay at home rule lifted after three months
description: People in Scotland are now being told to remain within their local authority for the next three weeks.

title: Covid 19: Pakistan among new countries added to England's travel ban list
description: Travel from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Kenya or the Philippines will not be allowed from 9 April.

title: Sachin Tendulkar: India cricket legend in hospital with Covid-19
description: Sachin Tendulkar says he is in hospital "as a matter of abundant precaution under medical advice".

title: Diving World Cup cancelled because of governing body's concern over Covid-19 precautions in Japan
description: The Diving World Cup in Tokyo is cancelled by Fina because the organising body's planned Covid-19 precautions "will not properly ensure" athletes' safety.

title: Tiger Roll to miss Irish National for Aintree
description: Two-time Grand National winner Tiger Roll will miss the Irish National on Monday and run in the Betway Bowl at Aintree next week instead.

title: Queen Elizabeth Hospital: Propped-up roof a 'direct risk to life'
description: The boss of an ageing hospital with a collapsing roof says it needs "more than short-term fixes".

title: USS Johnston: Sub dives to deepest-known shipwreck
description: A submersible has reached the USS Johnston, which lies 6.5km beneath the waves in the Pacific.

title: Boohoo to probe price differences for same clothing
description: The same coat sold by Coast is more expensive than Dorothy Perkins despite both being owned by Boohoo.

title: Ban on care home residents taking trips faces legal challenge
description: Campaigners say banning residents aged 65 and over from taking trips outside homes is unlawful.

title: YouTuber James Charles admits messaging 16-year-olds
description: The 21-year-old posted a video addressing the recent accusations, saying he believed they were 18.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Covid passports' and 'green light for racists'
description: Several of Friday's papers look ahead to what the summer holidays could look like for Britons.

title: Then and now: Rising temperatures threaten corals
description: In a monthly feature, we explain how warming waters threaten the survival of a wonder of the seas.

title: Which prime minister didn’t enjoy life at No 10?
description: In the 300 years since the creation of the role of prime minister. So what's the job like?
